docs.lead_paragraph: Never during President Obama’s time in office has the state of the economy been better. Yet, as he prepares to deliver his fifth State of the Union address, rarely has he gotten such low marks from the public for his handling of it.

headline.main: Obama’s Puzzle: Economy Rarely Better, Approval Rarely Worse
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Puzzle: Economy Rarely Better, Approval Rarely Worse

docs.abstract: Pres Obama will make State of the Union address for fifth time during his presidency; never during his time in office has United States economy been better, yet rarely has he received such low marks from public for his handling of it.
docs.snippet: Never during President Obama’s time in office has the state of the economy been better. Yet, as he prepares to deliver his fifth State of the Union address, rarely has he gotten such low marks from the public for his handling of it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The justices’ order extending a bar on the Obama administration’s enforcement of paperwork rules is disappointing.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Supreme Court for extending temporary injunction barring the Obama administration's enforcement of paperwork rules to nun's group Little Sisters of the Poor; notes group, which operates nursing homes, declined to file paperwork explaining its religious exemption from providing birth control coverage as part of its employer health plan; expresses hope that injunction does not signal court's overall view on birth control mandates.
docs.snippet: The justices’ order extending a bar on the Obama administration’s enforcement of paperwork rules is disappointing.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is threatening a veto of legislation that would permanently ban federal funds for abortion.

headline.print_headline: White House Threatens Veto of House Abortion Bill

docs.snippet: The Obama administration is threatening a veto of legislation that would permanently ban federal funds for abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three prominent Republican senators on Monday called for replacing Obamacare with a package of election-year proposals intended to lower health insurance costs while retaining some elements of President Barack Obama's health reform law.

headline.main: Three Republican Senators Offer Obamacare Alternative
headline.print_headline: Three Republican Senators Offer Obamacare Alternative

docs.snippet: Three prominent Republican senators on Monday called for replacing Obamacare with a package of election-year proposals intended to lower health insurance costs while retaining some elements of President Barack Obama's health reform law.

docs.abstract: The deal for Sedgwick Claims Management Services is the latest multibillion-dollar transaction by Kohlberg Kravis Roberts in recent months.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: Businesses expect their companies to perform better this year but that optimism still isn't translating into a push to hire more workers, according to a new survey from the National Association for Business Economics.

headline.main: Survey: Businesses More Optimistic, but Not Hiring
headline.print_headline: Survey: Businesses More Optimistic, but Not Hiring
